intro: Petrophile ericifolia var. glabriflora, commonly known as the smooth-flowered heath, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces spikes of white or pale pink flowers, which are typically arranged in a cylindrical inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathland and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
